column1: ==Role in society==
Dwarves wanted their women to be protected from other races and they usually kept them concealed inside their mountain halls. They seldom traveled in the outside world
column4: they were dressed as men; with similar voice and appearance as male dwarves
column5: even when they are rarely seen they are usually mistaken for a male. All Dwarves had beards from the beginning of their lives; a similar statement was made in The_Making_of_Appendix_A#Durins_Folk.

column1: ===Family and fertility===
Women joined their husbands families. Women were seldom named in genealogies but if a son is seen to be 110 years younger than his father
column2: this usually indicates an elder daughter. Thorins sister Dís was named simply because of the gallant death of her sons Fíli and Kíli.

column1: Gimli stated that only approximately one-third of their population consisted of women
column2: which was the reason for the slow increase in population of the race.  Moreover
column3: while Dwarf-men outnumbered Dwarf-women two to one
column4: less than half of Dwarf-men actually married:  many preferred to spend their time with their crafts instead.  Meanwhile
column5: many Dwarf-women never took a husband either:  some desire none
column6: or desired one who could not or would not marry them
column7: in which case they would have no other.

column1: ==Misconceptions==
Because of the scarcity of Dwarf-women
column2: their secrecy and similarity in appearance to males
column4: many Men failed to recognize their existence. They believed that the Dwarves population was only of men
column5: and a legend said therefore that they were born by growing out of stone.
